brief_description: The "Pay & Play Scheme" aims to provide state-level players with training and practice opportunities at the Mega Sports Complex, Hotwar, Ranchi.
detailed_description: The "Pay & Play Scheme" was launched by the Department of Sports & Youth Affairs, Government of Jharkhand. The scheme aims to provide state-level players with training and practice opportunities at the Mega Sports Complex, Hotwar, Ranchi. The scheme includes 11 sports disciplines: athletics, badminton, lawn tennis, table tennis, shooting, gymnastics, basketball, taekwondo, volleyball, wrestling, and swimming.
benefits: Training in 11 diverse sports disciplines: athletics, badminton, lawn tennis, table tennis, shooting, gymnastics, basketball, taekwondo, volleyball, wrestling, and swimming under professional supervision. Free registration and membership for school students (up to Class 10 th ) with the principal's recommendation. Free registration and membership for international/national participants and medalists. Athletics players enjoy 15 days of free access (non-repetitive).
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Jharkhand. The applicant should be a sportsperson. The applicant should actively participate in state-level sports. The students up to class 10 th with a recommendation from the school principal and National/international participants or medalists are eligible to apply.

steps: Step 1: The applicant downloads the application form the official website.
Step 2: Fill out the form with accurate details and attach the required documents.
Step 3: Submit the form at the Jharkhand State Sports Promotion Society office.
Step 4: Pay the registration fee (₹50) and the relevant membership fee, if applicable.
Other athletes are willing to pay registration and membership fees. Fee Table (https://sports.jharkhand.gov.in/documents/Pay-and-Play.pdf)

documents_required: Two Passport-size Photo Identity Proof Birth Certificate Proof Indicates (that the applicant is not suffering from any contagious disease) Demand Draft for Fee
